snippet: The Food and Drug Administration’s announcement comes after studies revealed chickens had higher-than-normal levels of the compound, which is primarily used to prevent disease and promote animal growth.
abstract: Food and Drug Administration, in resolving longstanding dispute, announces it will rescind approval for three of four arsenic drugs that had been used in animal feeds at request of companies Zoetis and Fleming Labs, which market them.
lead_paragraph: The Food and Drug Administration’s announcement comes after studies revealed chickens had higher-than-normal levels of the compound, which is primarily used to prevent disease and promote animal growth.

headline.main: F.D.A. Bans Three Arsenic Drugs Used in Poultry and Pig Feeds
headline.print_headline: F.D.A. Bans Three Arsenic Drugs Used in Poultry and Pig Feeds
